title: Revert Colorways changes
content:
On startup this morning, I saw the Colorways options. I tried a few, but decided to keep my Dark theme.

One of the first set of Colorways options was "no option," a circle with a slash. On the new Firefox View > Colorways page, that is no longer an option. I tried Settings > Manage Colors, to no avail.

The Firefox I'm using now has screwed up colors. I want to revert to the Firefox I had on startup. How do I do that?
creator: dpdp1

title: Scratch quick find key lock.
content: Customizable/removable keybinds. / and ' both make Quick Find appear which also (on Scratch) locks the key to be held after release (I had to hold ctrl and the key to make it stop detecting key pressed) I even made a script to detect which keys were pressed and I used that to find the culprit. ngl this is why Edge is better lololollolololololololololoollollolloololllool also I can't upload video for this report so go to vid here for that: https://youtu.be/NYSJOuGXo3k

title: File "bookmarks.html" in Profiles not updating.
content:
I'm on two Apple machines, both running Monterey 12.6, a 2014 Intel Mac Mini and a 2020 M1 MacBook Pro. Both updated to Firefox 106.0 yesterday. The MacBook Pro seems fine, but the Mac Mini "bookmarks.html" file is not being updated. I noticed this as when I run backups, I have a script that copies the file from my profile into a folder so the backup program can back it up along with other files.

In the profiles location I have a folder named "bookmarkbackups" and a file named "bookmarks.html." Is there a setting that needs to be set/changed so the html file continues to be updated?

title: Turn Search Tabs Off
content:
Once again Firefox adds a feature I don't want and can't disable. I want not to have a tab bar. They take up too much screen and get in the way. So I fond code that eliminates the tab bar unless there is more than one tab. Then the latest release addes the 'search tab' down arrow I neither want nor ever asked for and I can't get rid of it.

Why do you insist on doing this Mozilla? How do I turn this useless feature off?
creator: dhphoto

title: How can I *completely and for all of time* turn OFF all the tabs that popup when I first open Firefox?
content:
I opened Firefox today, and the screenshot opened in a new tab. I *never* want to see *ANY* of these popups at all ever. I've already gone into about:config and turned off "Whats New", Studies, and Pocket (first thing I do on any Firefox install). I still see things like this, or "Try New Themes" or other ones like that. I would hope there is a universal, forever and always "TURN THIS OFF" setting that I'm not seeing. Thanks for your time.

If not, can this be "bug reported"? As it is clearly a bug not to allow users to disable this.

I'm on Windows 10 if that makes a difference.
creator: pgso6x8r

title: How to remove "Independent voices / Colorways" from 106?
content:
Firefox 106 update just came in here. The whats new took me to a tab where something like "Independent Voices". Curious to what this was about I clicked on the button "Change colorways"

Now I have an ugly color on some toolbars and backgrounds.

This article says "To disable a Colorway or select a new theme: Click the Disable button on the Colorway card under Manage Your Themes"

Under Manage Your Themes I see Disable and Enable buttons on all themes except... Colorways.

It also says "Expires January 17" (which year?). I hope I don't have to wait that long to get rid of this.

title: Google is the first suggestion in address bar, even though it is not set as my search engine
content:
I set my default search engine to DuckDuckGo. Still, when I open a new tab and click on the address bar (without typing anything), "Search with google" is the first suggestion, followed by recent history.

I don't want Google there, it is not my default search engine, and I even removed it from my "Search shortcuts". I would expect either "Search with DuckDuckGo", since I explicitly set that as my search engine, or better yet, no search engine at all (since the address bar itself already functions as my access to search).

title: Prevent websites to use dark theme
content:
Hello,

I know this question is probably somewhere here but I can't find the answer (what I tried below).

So, I have a Debian 10 computer, with Firefox 78.15.0esr. I'm using the Adwaita (dark version) theme on my OS.

The problem is that Firefox uses the dark theme in Its menus (I don't mind) but It transmits to websites this setting and thus, websites supporting dark mode use it (Google, DuckDuckGo for example). I don't like that. I want them to use the light mode but keeping my theme on my OS.

So, I tried to change the value to 0, 1, 2, 3 (I tried each for them) for the setting layout.css.prefers-color-scheme.content-override and put "Adwaita:light" in the widget.content.gtk-theme-override field in about:config. Each time I restarted Firefox. It never works, websites still continue to use the dark theme...

Thanks in advance
creator: DimGoodStuff

title: Firefox
content:
Hi, I have been a Firefox user for 30 years, so I want to comment on your product. Every year I notice the performance of the browser getting worse and worse, more and more errors unexpected closures and slowdowns, it's bad to work because such small crashes make you look for another alternative. I do not write this maliciously, but that you think about how to improve the performance and speed of firefox. I only hope that someone wise will read this and pass it on to the higher-ups to make real changes.

In any case, you are going in the right direction and I still consider firefox with the most friendly and easy to use browser.

greetings to the team

Andrzej Nowacki
creator: aleuty11
